headline: These Top Oil Stocks Are Handing Their Investors a Lot of Cash, With Even More Expected to Flow to Shareholders in 2025 and Beyond
summary: Oil prices have bounced around quite a bit this year.  West Texas Intermediate, the primary U.S. oil price benchmark, has traded as high as the mid-$80s and as low as the mid-$60s.  Many oil companies are generating a lot more cash than they need.
